intro: Valerianella boissieri, commonly known as the mountain valerian, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Caprifoliaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically has hairy stems and heart-shaped leaves, and it thrives in well-drained, rocky soils. It is often found in alpine meadows and is valued for its ornamental appeal. Valerianella boissieri is also noted for its ability to tolerate harsh environmental conditions.
